attributes.action: award gallantry medals to Angus Campbell, George Brawley and Arthur Burton Garbett who showed great public spirit and disregard for their own safety in the pursuit of Ramzi Mohammed, subsequent to his attempt to detonate a bomb on the London Underground.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: These three men confronted and attempted to arrest the convicted bomber Ramzi Mohammed as he tried to escape the scene of his failed attempt to kill innocent civilians on the London Underground.  They thought nothing of the consequences of their actions on themselves, and in their actions served as examples of courage and and public spirit.  The success or otherwise of their attempts is not material - it is their action and motivation that counts.
